9:
Each test has its own set of parameters that can be used to validate specific functionality on your website. These parameters are usually specific IDs or classes for the components you want to interact with, such as links, buttons, forms, and other interactive elements. The answers to these parameters can vary based on the specific implementation of your website, so it's important to test them thoroughly to ensure they are working correctly.

Here are some examples of the parameters you may need to test for different functions:

function | parameter name
---------|--------------
 Read Product Overview | overview_text_id (the ID of the component containing the product overview text)
 List Key Features | features_list_id (the ID of the list component containing the key features)
 View Pricing Plans | pricing_table_id (the ID of the table component containing the pricing information)

The values for these parameters can be determined by viewing your website's source code or using a browser development tool to inspect the page elements. Alternatively, you can use automated testing tools such as Selenium or Appium to interact with your website and retrieve the necessary IDs or classes automatically.

It's important to note that the answers to these parameters may change over time based on updates to your website, so it's important to test them frequently to ensure they continue to work correctly.
